title: In Tank meta where the mid lane is dominated by Azir and Cass
body: Where is Kayle? When you think of sustained damage mid laners like Azir and Cassiopeia, Kayle slots right in there, but we haven't seen her in ages, is she really that bad a champion???

replies.body:
I guess it all comes down to the ultimate?

Kayle's ult doesn't give as great as offensive capability with Cass and Azir.
Baiting people to trying to kill you when you have Intervention off cooldown doesn't count as offensive capability I don't think.

Kayle is good. No idea why no one plays her though. She might be a good jungler with the new jungle item Runeglaive and she provides lots of utility to the team. Maybe ppl don't play her because they forgot about her after riot nerfed her Ap ratios quite a bit ?
Don't worry, I've been getting back into my Kayle
Kayle has really short range compared to other mages that deal damage from remote locations (azir soldiers, cass poison and karthus q ect)

The one thing I can thing of is scaling. Although Kayle does provide alot of sustained ap damage late/mid and late game, Azir and Cass both deal a reasonable amount of damage early, and have much more reasonable early games.

Have you played against a kayle? Her E makes her a monster early, while most mages get a skillshot or something that can be used every 10 seconds or whatever, kayle gets a constant stream of damage, so if you're willing to take the 100 or so damage from a level 1 mage skillshot you can dish out 3 times that much in autos as they run away. not to mention that with a few points in it, her E becomes basically a permanent buff.
